alert.note: Alert for Miami-Dade (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 09 at 2:07PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Florida, including the following county, Miami-Dade. * WHEN...Until 330 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 206 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated that the thunderstorms have moved out of the area. However, between 1 to 3 inches of rainfall has fallen over the area from the thunderstorms. This amount of water will take sometime to drain away. Therefore, the Flood Advisory will remain in effect until 330 PM EDT this afternoon. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Doral, Sweetwater, Tamiami, University Park, Kendale Lakes, Fountainbleau, Olympia Heights and Kendall West. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
